summary: Sexual harassment, categorized under criminal law within EU legal frameworks, refers to unwanted and inappropriate behavior of a sexual nature that creates a hostile environment. It encompasses various forms of misconduct, including verbal, non-verbal, and physical acts. The EU has established directives aimed at preventing sexual harassment in workplaces and educational institutions, promoting gender equality and safeguarding individual rights. Member States are required to implement effective legal measures to combat this issue, ensuring victims have access to justice and support. The concept is integral to the EU's broader commitment to uphold human dignity and protect against discrimination.
